acab663c290e06d50158d7020fc6e212455b4932;cs <cs.temporary@icloud.com>;1573859409;+0000;CVE-2019-16865: Upgrade pillow\n\nPatches the low-severity CVE-2019-16865 by upgrading pillow to 6.2.1. From the GitHub security alert:\n\n> An issue was discovered in Pillow before 6.2.0. ad5bf51e14f21e3ba08897ccd3df83b423c8b11a;Conor Schaefer <conor@freedom.press>;1517256453;-0800;Upgrades Ansible to > 2.4, removes pycrypto\n\nThe pycrypto dependency for Ansible < 2.4 contains known vulnerabilities, e.g. CVE-2013-7459, so it should not be included. Fortunately Ansible 2.4 dropped the dependency, so a simple pip-compile action on the `requirements.in` file, after updating the Ansible version referenced there, is sufficient to upgrade.

ae0711b2f6b74989465559e6df04b948c5f9c183;Jared Halpern <jared@jaredhalpern.com>;1555774607;-0400;Update to urllib3 as per: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-11324 The urllib3 library before 1.24.2 for Python mishandles certain cases where the desired set of CA certificates is different from the OS store of CA certificates, which results in SSL connections succeeding in situations where a verification failure is the correct outcome. This is related to use of the ssl_context, ca_certs, or ca_certs_dir argument.

b2f97be4186e43431df899d05575fac886557f8d;Frode Aannevik <frode.aa@gmail.com>;1558471875;+0200;SEC: upgrade urllib3 dependency\n\n[CVE-2019-11324] is fixed in urllib3>=1.24.2\n\n - urllib3  1.24.1 => 1.25.2  - requests 2.21.0 => 2.22.0\n\nrequest upgraded to fix warnings about required urllib3 version\n\nCVE-2019-11324: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-11324
b2fa2d8266cd3935f96f5a1266292c7067714f3c;Stuart McLaren <stuart.mclaren@hp.com>;1433774992;+0000;Remove custom SSL compression handling\n\nCustom SSL handling was introduced because disabling SSL layer compression provided an approximately five fold performance increase in some cases. Without SSL layer compression disabled the image transfer would be CPU bound -- with the CPU performing the DEFLATE algorithm.  This would typically limit image transfers to < 20 MB/s. When --no-ssl-compression was specified the client would not negotiate any compression algorithm during the SSL handshake with the server which would remove the CPU bottleneck and transfers could approach wire speed.\n\nIn order to support '--no-ssl-compression' two totally separate code paths exist depending on whether this is True or False.  When SSL compression is disabled, rather than using the standard 'requests' library, we enter some custom code based on pyopenssl and httplib in order to disable compression.\n\nThis patch/spec proposes removing the custom code because:\n\n* It is a burden to maintain\n\n Eg adding new code such as keystone session support is more complicated\n\n* It can introduce additional failure modes\n\n We have seen some bugs related to the 'custom' certificate checking\n\n* Newer Operating Systems disable SSL for us.\n\n Eg. While Debian 7 defaulted to compression 'on', Debian 8 has compression  'off'. This makes both servers and client less likely to have compression  enabled.\n\n* Newer combinations of 'requests' and 'python' do this for us\n\n Requests disables compression when backed by a version of python which  supports it (>= 2.7.9). This makes clients more likely to disable  compression out-of-the-box.\n\n* It is (in principle) possible to do this on older versions too\n\n If pyopenssl, ndg-httpsclient and pyasn1 are installed on older  operating system/python combinations, the requests library should  disable SSL compression on the client side.\n\n* Systems that have SSL compression enabled may be vulnerable to the CRIME (https://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2012-4929) attack. Installations which are security conscious should be running the Glance server with SSL disabled.\n\nFull Spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/187674 Blueprint: remove-custom-client-ssl-handling\n\nChange-Id: I7e7761fc91b0d6da03939374eeedd809534f6edf
b2fd621de8a9951cab7e50c88aaf26892e54f062;keur <keur@ocf.berkeley.edu>;1533152567;-0700;update cryptography requirement (#50)\n\nhttps://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-10903    Version 2.3 is unaffected by the CVE.

b41b33f0b78ab675007eff873d879222f3a116f7;Nick Stenning <nick@whiteink.com>;1491389184;+0200;Upgrade to cryptography 1.8 (#4484)\n\nUpgrade to the latest cryptography, mainly to ensure that we're staying  current with security-critical libraries.    In particular, we appear to have entirely missed that cryptography 1.5.3  contained a security fix for an issue with HKDF, which we use for key  derivation (CVE-2016-9243).

b61220dc68e670515ca6b9cd9d2d6137be9cfdbc;root <root@stemq.io>;1546509659;+0000;Updated Django from 2.1 to 2.1.2 because of a security alert: CVE-2018-16984 More information high severity Vulnerable versions: >= 2.1, < 2.1.2 Patched version: 2.1.2 An issue was discovered in Django 2.1 before 2.1.2, in which unprivileged users can read the password hashes of arbitrary accounts. The read-only password widget used by the Django Admin to display an obfuscated password hash was bypassed if a user has only the "view" permission (new in Django 2.1), resulting in display of the entire password hash to those users. This may result in a vulnerability for sites with legacy user accounts using insecure hashes.

b6cf913b6ec7a47ca3d3408aebe6d41ee59e1fd8;Kirby Kuehl <kkuehl@gmail.com>;1585672245;-0700;CVE-2020-10108 high severity Vulnerable versions: < 20.3.0 Patched version: 20.3.0 In Twisted Web through 19.10.0, there was an HTTP request splitting vulnerability. When the second content-length value was set to zero, the request body was interpreted as a pipelined request.\n\nCVE-2020-10109 high severity Vulnerable versions: < 20.3.0 Patched version: 20.3.0 In Twisted Web through 19.10.0, there was an HTTP request splitting vulnerability. When presented with a content-length and a chunked encoding header, the content-length took precedence and the remainder of the request body was interpreted as a pipelined request.

b863f8dfcdaf2f5138f8def874be7f3b07d91bac;Jorge Senín <jorge@senin.org>;1543562882;+0100;Update request version due security fail\n\nRemediation  Upgrade requests to version 2.20.0 or later. Details  CVE-2018-18074 More information  moderate severity  Vulnerable versions: <= 2.19.1  Patched version: 2.20.0  The Requests package through 2.19.1 before 2018-09-14 for Python sends an HTTP Authorization header to an http URI upon receiving a same-hostname https-to-http redirect, which makes it easier for remote attackers to discover credentials by sniffing the network.

b8aeec655023ca5624f17b1a4eb9425048d64ac0;MOFFIO <32306164+MOFFIO@users.noreply.github.com>;1538910300;+0300;Updated according to CVE-2018-14574\n\nUpdated requirements.txt according to CVE-2018-14574
b90a536aa6751bbd27ee5ae4294c69292d349cba;Nick Stenning <nick@whiteink.com>;1491403605;+0200;Upgrade bleach and html5lib (#4490)\n\nhtml5lib before 0.99999999 (eight nines) has a couple of XSS  vulnerabilities (CVE-2016-9909 and CVE-2016-9910).    Upgrading to the latest html5lib (0.999999999, nine nines) requires that  we upgrade bleach to 2.0.0, which in turn requires a few small changes  in our code that integrates with bleach. These include:    - attribute filter callables now always take the tag name as the first    parameter  - linkify callbacks now expose attributes as a dictionary of    _namespaced_ attributes, so we have to use tuples as keys into the    dictionary rather than simple strings    At the same time, it made sense to use the Cleaner and LinkifyFilter  classes, new in 2.0, which make it possible to configure sanitisation  and linkification once and reuse the configuration for each string to be  sanitised.

bfdd9b2fcc840a5411313581245d2dc0cda6c138;pyup.io bot <github-bot@pyup.io>;1539951433;-0700;Update requests to 2.20.0 (#392)\n\nThis PR updates [requests](https://pypi.org/project/requests) from **2.19.1** to **2.20.0**.        <details>    <summary>Changelog</summary>             ### 2.20.0     ```     -------------------    **Bugfixes**    -   Content-Type header parsing is now case-insensitive (e.g.      charset=utf8 v Charset=utf8).  -   Fixed exception leak where certain redirect urls would raise      uncaught urllib3 exceptions.  -   Requests removes Authorization header from requests redirected      from https to http on the same hostname. (CVE-2018-18074)  -   `should_bypass_proxies` now handles URIs without hostnames (e.g.      files).    **Dependencies**    - Requests now supports urllib3 v1.24.    **Deprecations**    - Requests has officially stopped support for Python 2.6.     ```           </details>           <details>    <summary>Links</summary>        - PyPI: https://pypi.org/project/requests    - Changelog: https://pyup.io/changelogs/requests/    - Homepage: http://python-requests.org  </details>

c876fc5b565f975d41ae8d42feab013a17d76047;NicolasFlandrois <n.flandrois9github@gmail.com>;1587484086;+0200;Dependabot - Security Update - Django Version (Django>=2.2.10)\n\nChanged Django version in requirements.txt Django>=2.2.10 ------------------------ 2 Django vulnerabilities found in requirements.txt 7 days ago Remediation Upgrade Django to version 2.2.10 or later. For example:\n\nDjango>=2.2.10 Always verify the validity and compatibility of suggestions with your codebase.\n\nDetails CVE-2020-7471 moderate severity Vulnerable versions: >= 2.0.0, < 2.2.10 Patched version: 2.2.10 Django 1.11 before 1.11.28, 2.2 before 2.2.10, and 3.0 before 3.0.3 allows SQL Injection if untrusted data is used as a StringAgg delimiter (e.g., in Django applications that offer downloads of data as a series of rows with a user-specified column delimiter). By passing a suitably crafted delimiter to a contrib.postgres.aggregates.StringAgg instance, it was possible to break escaping and inject malicious SQL.\n\nCVE-2019-19844 moderate severity Vulnerable versions: >= 2.0.0, < 2.2.9 Patched version: 2.2.9 Django before 1.11.27, 2.x before 2.2.9, and 3.x before 3.0.1 allows account takeover. A suitably crafted email address (that is equal to an existing user's email address after case transformation of Unicode characters) would allow an attacker to be sent a password reset token for the matched user account. (One mitigation in the new releases is to send password reset tokens only to the registered user email address.)

cbe246a1e5aba911c922e306a58696a535ab83c2;pyup.io bot <github-bot@pyup.io>;1546618345;-0800;Update django to 2.1.5 (#490)\n\nThis PR updates [Django](https://pypi.org/project/Django) from **2.1.4** to **2.1.5**.        <details>    <summary>Changelog</summary>             ### 2.1.5     ```     ==========================    *January 4, 2019*    Django 2.1.5 fixes a security issue and several bugs in 2.1.4.    CVE-2019-3498: Content spoofing possibility in the default 404 page  -------------------------------------------------------------------    An attacker could craft a malicious URL that could make spoofed content appear  on the default page generated by the ``django.views.defaults.page_not_found()``  view.    The URL path is no longer displayed in the default 404 template and the  ``request_path`` context variable is now quoted to fix the issue for custom  templates that use the path.    Bugfixes  ========    * Fixed compatibility with mysqlclient 1.3.14 (:ticket:`30013`).    * Fixed a schema corruption issue on SQLite 3.26+. You might have to drop and    rebuild your SQLite database if you applied a migration while using an older    version of Django with SQLite 3.26 or later (:ticket:`29182`).    * Prevented SQLite schema alterations while foreign key checks are enabled to    avoid the possibility of schema corruption (:ticket:`30023`).    * Fixed a regression in Django 2.1.4 (which enabled keep-alive connections)    where request body data isn&#39 t properly consumed for such connections    (:ticket:`30015`).    * Fixed a regression in Django 2.1.4 where    ``InlineModelAdmin.has_change_permission()`` is incorrectly called with a    non-``None`` ``obj`` argument during an object add (:ticket:`30050`).      ==========================     ```           </details>           <details>    <summary>Links</summary>        - PyPI: https://pypi.org/project/django    - Changelog: https://pyup.io/changelogs/django/    - Homepage: https://www.djangoproject.com/  </details>

cc6f911d0acefafe8ffe6ef07d985ed8219a30a7;Toru Takahashi <toru-takahashi@users.noreply.github.com>;1553834277;+0900;Update urllib3>=1.23 \n\nCVE-2018-20060 More information  high severity  Vulnerable versions: < 1.23  Patched version: 1.23  urllib3 before version 1.23 does not remove the Authorization HTTP header when following a cross-origin redirect (i.e., a redirect that differs in host, port, or scheme). This can allow for credentials in the Authorization header to be exposed to unintended hosts or transmitted in cleartext.

d4b7760de523c57378eac35e9e800c7633976f7d;Daniel Silva Ferreira Bruno <dsfbstudent@yahoo.com.br>;1581177851;-0300;CVE-2019-19844 Bugfix\n\nCVE-2019-19844 Bugfix:\n\nUpdating Django version to: 2.2.10.\n\nCause: Django before 1.11.27, 2.x before 2.2.9, and 3.x before 3.0.1 allows account takeover. A suitably crafted email address (that is equal to an existing user's email address after case transformation of Unicode characters) would allow an attacker to be sent a password reset token for the matched user account. (One mitigation in the new releases is to send password reset tokens only to the registered user email address.)

This time is variable and depends on the boot process.\n\nCurrent implementation is specific for Windows (WinRM) only, this will be fixed shortly.\n\nThis fixes #19998\n\n* Support other transport types\n\n* Various improvements\n\n- Fix reported typo - Add transport_test support in accelerate plugin - Ensure port is an integer\n\n* Improve examples\n\n* Small fixes\n\n- Use correct This patch addresses that by adding the option to point ansible-galaxy at a role skeleton directory.  The contents of this directory are then copied (or rendered) into the output role directory.  Appropriate command line options and configuration entries are added to allow for further customization from the role skeleton.\n\n* Remove dependency on platforms list from test\n\nPlatforms are no longer provided to the template by galaxy init. This change fixes that in one way, though not exactly as the docs say. The rules are:\n\n1) INI/script < inventory dir < playbook dir 2) "all" group vars < other group_vars < host_vars\n\nSo the new order will be (from the test script mentioned above):\n\n8. pb_host_vars_file - var in playbook/host_vars/host 9. ini_host_vars_file - var in inventory/host_vars/host 10. ini_host - host var inside the ini 11. pb_group_vars_file_child - var in playbook/group_vars/child 12. ini_group_vars_file_child - var in inventory/group_vars/child 13. pb_group_vars_file_parent - var in playbook/group_vars/parent 14. ini_group_vars_file_parent - var in inventory/group_vars/parent 15. pb_group_vars_file_all - var in playbook/group_vars/all 16. ini_group_vars_file_all - var in inventory/group_vars/all 17. ini_child - child group var inside the ini 18. ini_parent - parent group var inside the ini 19. ini_all - all group var inside the ini\n\nFixes #21845\n\n# This is the commit message #10:\n\nDisable failing tests until they can be fixed.\n\n# This is the commit message #1:\n\nadds eos_system integration tests (#22214)\n\n* adds integration test cases * updates eos_system with minor bug fixes\n\n# This is the commit message #2:\n\nRe-enable ssh retry tests with isolation fixes (#22221)\n\n* Re-enable ssh retry tests with isolation fixes * Don't use mock, use monkeypatch instead\n\n# This is the commit message #3:\n\nBumping docs footer copyright year (#22210)\n\n# This is the commit message #4:\n\nClarified when control_path is ignored (#20968)\n\n# This is the commit message #5:\n\nUpdate documentation for passwordstore lookup (#21448)\n\n* Update documentation for passwordstore lookup\n\n* Style fixes\n\n* Style fixes\n\n* Reword introduction text\n\n* Update playbooks_lookups.rst\n\nMinor tweaks.\n\n# This is the commit message #6:\n\nUpdate dead support link (#22212)\n\n* Update dead support link\n\nVisit https://www.ansible.com/, and you'll find the support link points to this URL, https://access.redhat.com/products/ansible-tower-red-hat/.\n\nThe current link is a dead link.\n\n* update github code blocks link\n\n# This is the commit message #7:\n\nansible_winrm_kerberos_delegation (#22113)\n\nAdd a note of how to turn on delegation when using kerberos.\n\n# This is the commit message #8:\n\nFixes #22136 (#22137)\n\n# This is the commit message #9:\n\nAdd flag to Docker pull_image to know when the image is already latest (#21508)\n\n* Add flag to Docker pull_image to know when the image is already latest\n\nWhenever the flag pull is set to 'yes' the resource is always defined as 'changed'. (#22368)\n\nIf a user makes a PR with a single, detailed commit message, github will put that at the top of the PR. Users can then easily merge the two together or supplement the commit message with additional information that we ask for.\n\n# This is the commit message #3:\n\nrename return var to avoid conflicts\n\nfixes #22323\n\n# This is the commit message #4:\n\nfix 'ungrouped' issue with some inventory formats\n\n# This is the commit message #5:\n\nfixed ungrouped definition\n\n# This is the commit message #6:\n\nDocument synchronize limitations around become and connections (#22373)\n\n* Document synchronize limitations around become and connections\n\n# This is the commit message #7:\n\nBad extra early (#22322)\n\n* catch bad extra vars data earlier\n\n* incoporated @alkins feedback\n\n# This is the commit message #8:\n\ncomposer: fix escape working_dir (#22363)\n\n* composer: fix escaping of path working_dir\n\n* composer: fix pep8\n\n# This is the commit message #9:\n\nec2_group: description is only required when group state is present (#19791)\n\n* description is only required when group state is present\n\nalso note that AWS requires a non-empty description when creating a security group\n\n* clarify description requirement\n\n# This is the commit message #10:\n\nRetain vault password as bytes in 2.2 (#22378)\n\n* Retain vault password as bytes in 2.2\n\nPrior to 2.2.1, the vault password was read in as byes and then remained bytes all the way through the code.  A bug existed where bytes and text were mixed, leading to a traceback with non-ascii passwords.  In devel, this was fixed by changing the read in password to text type to match with our overall strategy of converting at the borders.  This was backported to stable-2.2 for the 2.2.1 release.\n\nOn reflection, this should not have been backported as it causes passwords which were originally non-utf-8 to become utf-8.  People will then have their working 2.2.x vault files become in-accessible.\n\nthis commit pipes bytes all the way through the system for vault password.  That way if a password is read in as a non-utf-8 character sequence, it will continue to work in 2.2.2+.  This change is only for the 2.2 branch, not for 2.3 and beyond.\n\nWhy not everywhere?  The reason is that non-utf-8 passwords will cause problems when vault files are shared between systems or users.  If the password is read from the prompt and one user/machine has a latin1 encoded locale while a second one has utf-8, the non-ascii password typed in won't match between machines.  Deal with this by making sure that when we encrypt the data, we always use valid utf-8.\n\nFixes #20398\n\n(cherry picked from commit 5dcce0666a81917c68b76286685642fd72d84327)\n\n# This is the commit message #1:\n\nMoved exception handler in a little bit (#22376)\n\nIt wasn't being caught in the previous indentation\n\n# This is the commit message #2:\n\nCreate bot friendly sanity output. msg var from the vars.yml\n\n# This is the commit message #9:\n\nFix dynamodb pep8 issues (#23032)\n\n# This is the commit message #10:\n\ncron: don't force changed=True when old crontab was empty\n\nThe cron module forces changed=True when there was no real change, but the original crontab did not contain a final newline, which is mandatory.\n\nWhen the user has no crontab or the user does not exist at all, crontab -l exits with 1 and the cron module correctly interprets this as "no crontab" and stores the old crontab as "".\n\nHowever this triggers changed=True, even if we're not going to change anything, e.g. when removing a crontab entry from a user who has no crontabs at all.\n\nLet's special-case the fact that the old crontab is empty and not force changed=True in that case.\n\n# This is the commit message #1:\n\nremoved bad ignore as host can override connection\n\nalso breaks testing network modules\n\n# This is the commit message #2:\n\nminor correction to module (#23081)\n\n# This is the commit message #9:\n\nSplit on newlines when searching for become prompt\n\nThe fix for leading junk in sudo output: fee6e29 causes problems with ssh + sudo.  On the initial connection using ControlPersist, the output that we scan for the prompt contains both the command we're sending to configure the prompt and the prompt itself.  The code in fee6e29 ends up sending the password when it sees the line configuring the prompt which is too early.\n\nSwitch to a version that splits on lines and then checks whether the first or last line starts with the prompt to decide if it's time to send the password.\n\nFixes #23054 References #20858\n\n# This is the commit message #10:\n\nrestores pre 2.3 behavior with respects to keys (#23083)\n\nThis removes the requirement to configure look_for_keys=False and restores the behavior to disable key lookup if no key was provided.\n\n# This is the commit message #1:\n\nDo not re.search show configuration stdout if empty (#23087)\n\nIf the banner is not set, the stdout of 'show configuration | begin banner <banner>' returns empty string thus the re.search raises an exception.\n\nFixes #22216\n\n# This is the commit message #2:\n\nTreats both [] and {} as equal to None (#23088)\n\n# This is the commit message #3:\n\nFix ios_config return on python 2.4 (#23094)\n\n# This is the commit message #4:\n\nFix 'sequence' lookup shortcut syntax and documentation (#22989)\n\n* fix 'sequence' lookup shortcut syntax and documentation\n\n* Update playbooks_loops.rst\n\nMinor edits for grammar and clarity.\n\n* Update playbooks_loops.rst\n\nAnother tweak for clarity.\n\n# This is the commit message #5:\n\nec2: fix instids and res_list being referenced before assigned - The character set used by Ansible\n\n(upper & lowercase letters, digits)\n\ndid not match that used by libc crypt\n\n(upper & lowercase letters, digits, full stop, forward slash).\n\nThis resulted in a slightly smaller key space, and hence hashes would be slightly easier to attack (e.g. by dictionary, brute force).\n\n# This is the commit message #10:\n\nFixes generators and other misc fixes (#22887)\n\nfixed itertools.imap busting several things that used to be lists, profiles not being set correctly, upon create, when it was a separate method, allowed port having the wrong lowest port (zero is allowed), empty port value should just be interpreted as None.\n\n# This is the commit message #1:\n\nRemoves expanduser in favor of type path (#21369)\n\nRemoves the usage of expanduser in favor of the type 'path' for module options. exception as expected\n\nThe current ThrottlingException handling code hides other actual exceptions from the user, and basically goes infinite loop instead. eg when the api caller doesn't have permission (example below) to use the api, ansible effectively hangs. adding the re-raise stops execution and shows the error to the command line as expected\n\ncan test by removing permission to the efs api, and calling the efs: module\n\nThe error was: botocore.exceptions.ClientError: An error occurred (AccessDeniedException) when calling the DescribeFileSystems operation: User: <x> is not authorized to perform: elasticfilesystem:DescribeFileSystems on the specified resource\n\n* PEP8 fix\n\n# This is the commit message #5:\n\nPull filesystems from dict in case is not string on libreoffice. So uninstalling libreoffice fails when libreoffice-oldstable is installed.\n\n``` PS C:\WINDOWS\system32> choco list --local-only libreoffice Chocolatey v0.10.3 libreoffice-oldstable 5.2.6 1 packages installed. PS C:\WINDOWS\system32> choco list --local-only --exact libreoffice Chocolatey v0.10.3 0 packages installed. ```\n\nThe solution is easy, just add `--exact`.\n\n# This is the commit message #8:\n\nAdd integration tests for group_by precedence.\n\nTest that, when a group is created with group_by, variables from the corresponding group_vars/ file are correctly pulled in, and override variables specified in group_vars/all.\n\nSee ansible/ansible#8664.\n\n# This is the commit message #9:\n\nAdd missing group_vars to group_by test.\n\n# This is the commit message #10:\n\ngit: git reset with branch\n\n`git reset <ref>` can be ambiguous and fail to switch to the correct branch. binary. Affects unarchiving of zip files. Since CRC values in zipfile are 32 bits the behaviour should be unchanged even in Python 2.\n\n# This is the commit message #7:\n\nUpdate the comments around Python 3\n\n[Enterprise Linux 5 is at the end of "End of Production 3 phase"](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_Hat_Enterprise_Linux#Product_life_cycle) so that is no longer a reasonable reason to wait.  Also removed the comments about [Python 3 not being mainstream](http://python3wos.mybluemix.net/201). Fixes #23689\n\n# This is the commit message #6:\n\nFix vault reading from stdin (avoid realpath() on non-links) (#23583)\n\n* Fix vault reading from stdin (avoid realpath() on non-links)\n\nos.path.realpath() is used to find the target of file paths that are symlinks so vault operations happen directly on the target.\n\nHowever, in addition to resolving symlinks, realpath() also returns a full path. when reading from stdin, vault cli uses '-' as a special file path so VaultEditor() will replace with stdin. realpath() was expanding '-' with the CWD to something like '/home/user/playbooks/-' causing errors like:\n\n        ERROR! [Errno 2] No such file or directory: u'/home/user/ansible/-'\n\nFix is to specialcase '-' to not use realpath()\n\nFixes #23567\n\n* to_text decrypt output when writing to stdout\n\n# This is the commit message #7:\n\nnicer docs\n\n# This is the commit message #8:\n\ns3_sync: removing irrelevant s3.list_buckets() call - If a file path has the top level dir name as a substring, galaxy replaces it with ''. In one example, the archive top level dir is 'go', so 'files/go-bin.sh' becomes 'files/-bin.sh'.\n\nFixes #22572, #23694, #23623\n\n# This is the commit message #8:\n\nFix Markdown formatting for With Debian, locales must be added to /etc/locale.gen before calling locale-gen command. With Ubuntu, /etc/locale.gen is updated by /usr/sbin/locale-gen.\n\nUse the locale-gen module which handles both distributions.\n\n# This is the commit message #5:\n\nFixes #23890 Remove idle ShellError exception and get_exception() method from nxos modules (#23947)\n\nRemove idle ShellError exception and get_exception() method from nxos modules\n\n# This is the commit message #6:\n\nDocs how to test (2nd) (#24094)\n\n* Big testing doc refactor * Combine all the testing documentation in to one place to make it easier to find * Convert everything to RST * Create testing_network guide * Create testing landing page * For each section detail "how to run" and "how to extend testing" * More examples * Lots more detail\n\n# This is the commit message #7:\n\nMinor testing docs improvements (#24103)\n\nFix a few formatting issues spotted post review. During this process, each retrieved Resource Pool is checked for the `parent` attribute, and if it exists, the currently-scoped parent object is compared against the Resource Pool's parent object. The method doing the check, however, `assert`s that the parent object is not `None`. In some cases, a Resource Pool will have the `parent` attr, but that `parent` object will be `None`, causing the `assert` to fail.\n\nThis should avoid that. :-)\n\n# This is the commit message #9:\n\nAdd support for specifying the modulepath for the Puppet module (#24122)\n\nPuppet modules are not always installed in the default location (i.e, /etc/puppet/modules) so it is useful to be able to specify an alternate location.\n\n# This is the commit message #10:\n\nAdd 'uuid' to the attributes returned from the vmware_vm_facts module. (#23773)\n\n# This is the commit message #1:\n\nRemove hack for backwards compatible v2_playbook_on_start callback\n\nJust after release of 2.0.0 (in 2.0.0.1) we had a change to the API of callbacks without bumping the API version.  We added the playbook to the arguments passed to the callbacks.\n\nThis wasn't in the Tower callback at the time.  In order to prevent breaking that callback we added a temporary hack to inspect the callback's API to decide if we needed to call it with arguments or not.\n\nWe scheduled the hack for removal in January 2017.  Since that's now past, removing the hack.\n\nChange signed off by matburt on the Tower side.\n\n# This is the commit message #2:\n\nFixes minor type in docs (#24117)\n\nRemoves an extra `e` from the word `batch` in the the `playbooks_delegation` documentation seen at: http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/playbooks_delegation.html\n\n# This is the commit message #3:\n\nFix circular import with unsafe_proxy, template, and vars\n\ntemplate/__init__.py imported unsafe_proxy from vars which caused vars/__init__.py to load.  vars/__init__.py needed template/__init__.py which caused issues. The solution to this has been fixed and refactored in 2.3 in form of parse_check_update(), but it still contains subtle bug, which makes such multi-lines invisible to later logic (such packages aren't included in parse_check_update()) output. The problem is caused by using '\1' in re.sub(), instead of proper r'\1', which literally puts unicode symbol \1 into resulting output.\n\n# This is the commit message #4:\n\nFix docs/api sphinx-build err on 'make rpm' (#24334)\n\nThe makefile in docs/api/ had a top level check for the 'sphinx-build' tool, but the check was getting triggered on 'make clean' when it is not needed and causing 'make rpm' and similar builds to fail.\n\nSo this commit removes the check.\n\nFixes #24163\n\n# This is the commit message #5:\n\nMigrate cs_sshkeypair test to ansible-test.\n\n# This is the commit message #6:\n\nPep8 fixes for Windows module (#24349)\n\nSigned-off-by: Abhijeet Kasurde <akasurde@redhat.com>\n\n# This is the commit message #7:\n\nPep8 fixes for digital_ocean_*\n\nSigned-off-by: Abhijeet Kasurde <akasurde@redhat.com>\n\n# This is the commit message #8:\n\nNew module to setup string group. This means the lookup result looses the unsafe protection and may become simple unicode strings, which can result in bad things being re-templated.\n\nThis also adds a global lookup param and cfg options for lookups to allow unsafe returns, so users can force the previous (insecure) behavior.\n\n# This is the commit message #5:\n\nfix spurious warnings with ansible_winrm_kinit_X args (#24380)\n\n* added to pywinrm arg whitelist * clarified error text on kinit_mode error * fixes #23822\n\n# This is the commit message #6:\n\npowershell: Add support for list parameters (#23131)\n\nThis is a first implementation of list parameters.\n\nIt will convert a single string, or comma-separated value into an Array.\n\n# This is the commit message #7:\n\nwindows: Various small documentation fixes (#23138)\n\n# This is the commit message #8:\n\nautomated integration tests for cloudstack (#20552)\n\n# This is the commit message #9:\n\nUpdate ansible-test change handling and CS plugin. #6:\n\nAdd junos integration test (#24404)\n\n# This is the commit message #7:\n\nInclude .git_keep files in role template skeleton (#24381)\n\nsetup.py will not install package_data this is just an empty directory, even if the globs in package_data match it.\n\nSo the role skeleton that was being installed to galaxy/data/*/ was excluding the files/ and templates/ directories since they were empty.\n\nSince the skeleton dir doesnt include those dirs 'ansible-galaxy init' would not set them up.\n\nSo this adds a .* glob to those directories so the .git_keep will be included as well, so that setup.py will create the otherwise empty directoty. ansible-galaxy init already knows to ignore those files, so no other changes are needed.\n\n(Including the .git_keep files is a little odd, but the alternative would be creating our own placeholder files. Since ansible-galaxy already understands .git_keep files we just reuse that)\n\nFixes #23597\n\n# This is the commit message #8:\n\nUpdating version vars for releases\n\n# This is the commit message #9:\n\nremoved autogenerated file and added to ignore\n\n# This is the commit message #10:\n\nWindows: Small fix to Add-Warning and Add-DeprecationWarning (#23520)\n\nSimplified the logic, and fix the issue of having a nested list as entry.\n\nAlso indicate that we deliberately want to retain $null values (and i.e. do not want them to be turned into a boolean).\n\n# This is the commit message #1:\n\nunit test for #24330 (#24346)\n\n# This is the commit message #2:\n\nec2_elb_lb: allow elb scheme to be updated by restarting the resource - fixes #19116 (#22916)\n\n* allow elb scheme to be updated by restarting the resource\n\nuse ensure_gone and require wait option\n\n* fix pep8\n\n* fix yaml\n\n* requested changes\n\n* fix fail_json\n\n# This is the commit message #3:\n\nslightly increase win_async_wrapper fire and forget sleeptime\n\n* should fix Shippable timeouts when AWS CPU credits are low- right on the bubble of failure w/ 5s execution\n\n# This is the commit message #4:\n\nUpdate netconf_config.py (#24323)\n\n* Update netconf_config.py\n\nImplementation proposal for feature request #24220\n\n* Update netconf_config.py\n\nfixed pep8 added code proposal for #24221\n\n* Update netconf_config.py\n\ncorrect more pep8 related things add some cosmetic changes\n\n# This is the commit message #5:\n\nSupport auto_remove in docker_container (#22929)\n\n* Support auto_remove in docker_container\n\n* Fail if not docker>=2 and auto_remove=True, don't set auto_remove in host_config if not docker>=2\n\n* Make quoting more readable in ansible errors\n\n# This is the commit message #6:\n\n[cloud][inventory] Get tags for RDS instances. UrlMaps allow users to segment requests by hostname and path and direct those requests to Backend Services.\n\nUrlMaps are a powerful and necessary part of HTTP(S) Global Load Balancing on Google Cloud Platform.\n\nUrlMap takes advantage of the python-api so the appropriate infrastructure has been added to module_utils.\n\nMore about UrlMaps can be found at: https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/load-balancing/http/url-map\n\nUrlMap API: https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/reference/latest/\n\nGoogle Cloud Platform HTTP(S) Cross-Region Load Balancer: https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/load-balancing/http/\n\n* updated documentation, remmoved parens\n\n* fixed tabs\n\n# This is the commit message #9:\n\ndeal with null/none connections\n\nfixes #23621 pushed 'connection resolution' to play_context override fieldattribute getter\n\n# This is the commit message #10:\n\nfix #24429 (#24491)\n\n# This is the commit message #1:\n\nAdd prompt to release playbook regarding completion of CHANGELOG edits\n\n# This is the commit message #2:\n\nAvoid default serialization of classes in dump_attrs\n\nFor playbook base objects, when dumping attributes via dump_attrs() an attribute like loop_control is a class. Using the default serialization for these is slow and consumes a lot of memory. Since LoopControl is also based on the Base class, we can use serialize() instead and save a lot of resources.\n\nThis also adds a from_attrs() complimentary method to nicely turn the dumped attrs back into proper field attributes.\n\nFixes #23579\n\n# This is the commit message #3:\n\nUpdate hosts.yaml (#24513)\n\nExample to clarify the rule : ``` Anything defined under a hosts is assumed to be a var```\n\n# This is the commit message #4:\n\nLittle documentation fix (#24522)\n\nAdded the 'reset_connection' option to the available choices\n\n# This is the commit message #5:\n\nFix pam_limits writing text to a file opened in binary mode\n\nFixes #24392\n\n# This is the commit message #6:\n\nFix template not showing a diff with a directory\n\nTemplate can take a directory as the destination.  When that's the case, we need to diff between the source and the file inside of the directory. That happened when the directory was specified with a trailing slash but not when it was specified on its own.  This change fixes that.\n\nFixes #24413\n\n# This is the commit message #7:\n\nMiscellaneous bug fixes for ansible-test.\n\n- Overhauled coverage injector to fix issues with non-local tests. - Updated integration tests to work with the new coverage injector. - Fix concurrency issue by using random temp files for delegation. - Fix handling of coverage files from root user. - Fix handling of coverage files without arcs. - Make sure temp copy of injector is world readable and executable.\n\n# This is the commit message #8:\n\nAdd support for on-demand coverage on Shippable.\n\nTriggered by setting the COVERAGE environment var to a non-empty value. Note that fixes are also needed to each terminal plugin.  This PR only fixes the ios terminal (as proof that this approach is workable.)  Future PRs can address the other terminal types.\n\n* On Python3, pickle needs to work with byte strings, not text strings. * Set the pickle protocol version to 0 because we're using a pty to feed data to the connection plugin.  A pty can't have control characters.  So we have to send ascii only.  That means only using protocol=0 for pickling the data. * ansible-connection isn't being used with py3 in the bug but it needs several changes to work with python3. * In python3, closing the pty too early causes no data to be sent.  So leave stdin open until after we finish with the ansible-connection process. * Fix typo using traceback.format_exc() * Cleanup unnecessary StringIO, BytesIO, and to_bytes calls * Modify the network_cli and terminal plugins for py3 compat.  Lots of mixing of text and byte strings that needs to be straightened out to be compatible with python3 * Documentation for the bytes<=>text strategy for terminal plugins * Update unittests for more bytes-oriented internals\n\nFixes #24355\n\n# This is the commit message #1:\n\nAdd check for processor_core value\n\nFixes #21893\n\nSigned-off-by: Abhijeet Kasurde <akasurde@redhat.com>\n\n# This is the commit message #2:\n\nRevert "[WIP]Fortios address group" (#24549)\n\n* Revert "Add check for processor_core value"\n\nThis reverts commit 8ad182059d5a085e4f8ecfe8ae63bad14a7dc01c.\n\n* Revert "Fix for persistent connection plugin on Python3 (#24431)"\n\nThis reverts commit d834412eadccca6428501544f398d1bb59084e98.\n\n* Revert "removing folded style formatting for synopsis (#22746)"\n\nThis reverts commit e539726543954c5b6b8067ef3946ab2020bb2a2f.\n\n* Revert "[WIP]Fortios address group (#21831)"\n\nThis reverts commit f2dbf512cb104ea30f0c24c8f190c27632e9b2f8.\n\n# This is the commit message #3:\n\nAdd pool_ids option to redhat_subscription (#23266)\n\n# This is the commit message #4:\n\n[cloud] Stop ec2_group module from authorizing duplicate rules (#24528)\n\n# This is the commit message #5:\n\nBe explicit about pickle protocol and encoding (#24454)\n\nOn Python3 and Python2 use pickle slightly differently so we need to be explicit about some things.\n\nIf pickles could be shared between python2 and python3, as in ansible-connection and the pickle cache, we need to specify the protocol to use when dumping and the encoding to use for byte strings when loading.\n\nThe dumping protocol needs to be no higher than 2 as python-2 only supports up to protocol 2.  The encoding should usually be 'bytes' so that python2 str type becomes python3 bytes type.  However, doing this means that we must make sure that the objects being serialized properly make their strings into text strings except when they're supposed to be bytes.  If strings are improperly byte strings, they may cause tracebacks on the receiving end\n\n# This is the commit message #6:\n\ncloudstack: return known used resources in fail_json (#24575)\n\n# This is the commit message #7:\n\nFix timeout issue in ansible-connection (#24556)\n\nFixes #24520 ansible-connection needs to wait on timeout value of play-context instead of ssh default timeout\n\n# This is the commit message #8:\n\nSupport py3 in plugin_formatter.py (#24384)\n\n* Support py3 in plugin_formatter.py\n\n* Do everything in bytes\n\n# This is the commit message #9:\n\nImplement on-demand coverage on Shippable. (#24535)\n\n# This is the commit message #10:\n\nImprove on-demand coverage for Shippable.\n\n# This is the commit message #1:\n\nSet facts type to dict\n\nWith newer versions of ansible, module arguments are assumed to be strings unless otherwise specified.  Our 'facts' argument is expected to be a dictionary, so tell ansible that.\n\nWithout this, the argument will arrive as a string and be written to the facter file inside string quotes.  Facter will produce the following error:\n\n  undefined method `each' for #<String:0x000000016ee640>\n\nThis was originally fixed and found in the Ansible Puppet role which is maintained by the OpenStack infrastructure team.\n\nhttps://github.com/openstack-infra/ansible-role-puppet/commit/8d0f0bfd0a7288b4bdc2782ed2d1dcf626e8a3ba\n\n# This is the commit message #2:\n\nFix bug in iam_role (#22618)\n\n# This is the commit message #3:\n\ncloudstack: add new module cs_network_acl (#24609)\n\n# This is the commit message #4:\n\nTemporarily disable cs_network_acl test in CI.\n\nThis test currently conflicts with cs_vpc, causing it to fail if both tests are run together.\n\n# This is the commit message #5:\n\nEnable codecov.io and add coverage grouping.\n\n# This is the commit message #6:\n\n[cloud] Document stage option on `serverless` module\n\n# This is the commit message #7:\n\nFix URLs in dev_guide documentation (#24533)\n\nSigned-off-by: Abhijeet Kasurde <akasurde@redhat.com>\n\n# This is the commit message #8:\n\nFix UnboundLocalError in basic.py\n\n* Fix for UnboundLocalError while accessing deprecations   in result * Add Unit test\n\nFixes #24592\n\nSigned-off-by: Abhijeet Kasurde <akasurde@redhat.com>\n\n# This is the commit message #9:\n\nActually protect against use_default_subnetpool\n\nWe have a protection against a user setting use_default_subnetpool in their playbook - but then we sure do pass the kwarg anyway. If so, de-reference it and pass the link target to the file module as 'dest'.\n\nThis change fixes an edge case in file copy behavior when:\n\n- 'dest' is a symlink to some other file ('realdest') - follow = True - the checksums of the source file, 'src', and the symlink target, 'realdest',   match.\n\nBecause the checksums match, the copy module is skipped and the file module is invoked directly with 'dest' = the symlink, and 'src' = the source of the copy module, whether that source is present on the target machine or not.\n\nWhen 'src' doesn't exist on the target machine, this leads to an error that looks like this because it can't change the target of the symlink:\n\nTASK [copy] ******************************************************************** fatal: [192.168.56.101]: FAILED! => {"changed": false, "checksum": "f572d396fae9206628714fb2ce00f72e94f2258f", "failed": true, "gid": 1000, "group": "ajdecon", "mode": "0777", "msg": "src file does not exist, use \"force=yes\" if you really want to create the link: /tmp/issue1568/dest_dir/source", "owner": "ajdecon", "path": "/tmp/issue1568/dest_dir/dest", "size": 8, "src": "source", "state": "link", "uid": 1000}\n\nWhen the path 'src' *does* exist on the target machine, the file module makes this the symlink "dest -> src" instead of "dest -> realdest"... even if the checksum of 'src' on the target machine is different from the checksum of 'src' on the machine where Ansible is running.\n\n# This is the commit message #3:\n\naix_lvol: PEP8, imports, cosmetics (#24717)\n\n- Make PEP8 compliant - Ensure imports are specific - Few cosmetic changes (sort lists, casing, punctuation)\n\n# This is the commit message #4:\n\nansible/errors: PEP8 compliancy (#24693)\n\n- Make PEP8 compliant\n\n# This is the commit message #5:\n\nansible/compat/: PEP8 compliancy (#24689)\n\n- Make PEP8 compliant\n\n# This is the commit message #6:\n\nexamples/: PEP8 compliancy (#24682)\n\n- Make PEP8 compliant\n\n# This is the commit message #7:\n\nslurp: PEP8, imports, cosmetics (#24677)\n\n- Make PEP8 compliant - Ensure imports are specific - Few cosmetic changes (sort lists, casing, punctuation)\n\n# This is the commit message #8:\n\nUpdate testing_units.rst (#24772)\n\n# This is the commit message #9:\n\nansible/constants: PEP8 compliancy (#24692)\n\n- Make PEP8 compliant\n\n# This is the commit message #10:\n\nFix transport getting set to None when not set explicitly (#24769)\n\nSigned-off-by: Trishna Guha <trishnaguha17@gmail.com>\n\n# This is the commit message #1:\n\nec2_group_facts tag list should have case preserved (#24760)\n\nTags should retain case, and should not be snake cased. Easiest way to do this is to snake before converting tag list as while that affects the keys of the boto3 tag lists, it doesn't affect the values. Need to use `tag_value_key_name` and `tag_name_key_name` following recent change to `boto3_tag_list_to_ansible_dict`, which used to handle both `key`/`Key` and `value`/`Value`\n\n# This is the commit message #2:\n\nRender returned dictionaries Fixes #24775 (#24777)\n\nplugin.rst.j2 was out of sync with syntax validator\n\n# This is the commit message #3:\n\nDowngraded more modules from Curated to Community (#24751)\n\n# This is the commit message #4:\n\n[GCP] remove ansible.utils.display for deprecations (#24738)\n\n* [GCP] remove ansible.utils.display for deprecations, use module.deprecate instead.\n\n* removed test file from legacy files\n\n# This is the commit message #5:\n\nFix more module returns (#24782)\n\n* Correct return structure\n\n* typo\n\n# This is the commit message #6:\n\n[GCP] Healthcheck module (#24564)\n\n* [GCP] Healthcheck module\n\n* fix return YAML block\n\n* removed update_ return value  removed python26 check  typos and docs updates\n\n* doc fix\n\n* Updated int test for no-update conditions\n\n* added filter_gcp_fields test\n\n* fixed bug in update where dictionary wasn't built correctly and port was not being set.\n\n* added default values to documentation block\n\n# This is the commit message #7:\n\nIncrease python version coverage for tests. #4:\n\ndocker_container: do not split command on commas (#24900)\n\n* docker_container: do not split command on commas\n\nFix issue #24430\n\n* docker_container: document command parameter\n\nPrior behavior was strange, splitting strings on commas only to join them again ... replacing commas with spaces.\n\nFYI, docker-py accepts strings or lists, using shlex.split on strings ... splitting on spaces while respecting things like quotes.\n\nhttps://github.com/docker/docker-py/blob/master/docker/api/container.py https://github.com/docker/docker-py/blob/master/docker/types/containers.py https://github.com/docker/docker-py/blob/master/docker/utils/utils.py\n\nMore info regarding Dockerfile syntax for CMD strings and lists can be found at https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/builder/#cmd\n\n# This is the commit message #5:\n\nFix logic surrounding copy and remote_src, remote_src is preferred, make copy action plugin only. Solved by deleting from the high indexes first so the lower ones remain stable.\n\n* Don't load configuration if nothing to load\n\nInstead of sending an empty candidate config (for example because the candidate only consisted of `delete` lines, and all of them were filtered out by `filter_delete_statements`) just return. JunOS seems to get confused by empty changes, and if the candidate config is empty then it's a no-op anyway.\n\n# This is the commit message #9:\n\nFixed markdown in changelog.md (#22980)\n\n# This is the commit message #10:\n\nAdd provider to prepare_ios_tests role tasks (#25162)\n\nThis avoids passing -u <user> -k, as it will just consume the credentials from group_vars\n\n# This is the commit This is the commit message #6:\n\nAvoid useless queries: use standard module hashlib\n\nWhen an unchanged MD5-hashed password was used and passlib was unavailable, an useless 'ALTER USER' query was executed.\n\nOnce this useless query avoided, the last 'SELECT' query becomes useless too.\n\n# This is the commit message #7:\n\npostgresql_user: add tests with hashed password\n\n# This is the commit message #8:\n\nCreates cluster the same way Debian package does\n\nThis task is only executed when the playbook has already been executed once, for example using 'ansible-test integration' with '--retry-error' switch when the first run fails.\n\nThis modification allows to recreate default databases (postgres, template0 and template1) using the same encoding that the one used by the Debian package.\n\nDefault encoding is 'SQL_ASCII' when default locale is not set in /etc/default/locale.\n\n# This is the commit message #9:\n\nPostgreSQL tests: enforce UTF8\n\nBy default, client encoding is determined either from the LANG_*/LC_* environment variables or using encoding of the database.\n\nContainers used in the CI don't define a default locale, then encoding of default databases was SQL_ASCII.\n\n# This is the commit message #10:\n\nAssorted nxos_bgp_* fixes (#25080)\n\n* Simplify apply_key_map\n\n* Fix nxapi\n\n* Clean up get_value\n\n* Fix missing non-values\n\n* Add test for existing bgp_af case\n\n* Fix small issues with bgp_neighbor_af\n\n# This is the commit message #1:\n\nAdd provider param to prepare_iosxr_tests role tasks (#25163)\n\nThis will avoid passing -u -k to ansible-playbook\n\n# This is the commit message #2:\n\nEnsure `when` warning is checked before expanding (#25092)\n\nThe `when` condition templating warning should only happen if the condition itself contains templating, not if variables in the condition are themselves composed through templating\n\nBefore\n\n``` vars:   x: hello   y: "{{ x }}"\n\ntasks: - debug: msg=hello   when: y ```\n\nwould fire a warning because `y` would get expanded to `{{ x }}`. This checks whether a warning is required prior to expansion.\n\n# This is the commit message #3:\n\nFix return code (#23592)\n\nThe Honeybadger API returns 201 for success, not 200.\n\n# This is the commit message #4:\n\ncontrib: PEP8 compliancy (#24680)\n\n- Make PEP8 compliant\n\n# This is the commit message #5:\n\napt: include arch in check for installed packages on multi-arch systems (#24846)\n\n* apt: include arch in check for installed packages on multi-arch systems\n\nThanks: Stefan Löwen <stefan.loewen@gmail.com>\n\nFixes: #24673\n\n* add an integration test for apt's multi-arch handling\n\n# This is the commit message #6:\n\nEnsure exit_json returns failed = False\n\nThis is required for modules that may return a non-zero `rc` value for a successful run, similar to #24865 for Windows fixing **win_chocolatey**.\n\nWe also disable the dependency on `rc` value only, even if `failed` was set.\n\nAdapted unit and integration tests to the new scheme. It hides the fact that the disconnection did not go as expected. Effectively the intended action was not successful, but the play continues.\n\n* Revert "added status code check"\n\nThis reverts commit fe2eb2ae4aeb4812fa2f59ccdfabc9efc677e657.\n\n* added command status code check\n\nIn the existing implementation the command is checked for the success. As a result failed execution is silently discarded. The change tests for return code and fails if it did not work.\n\n# This is the commit message #7:\n\nstart of 'profiling utils'\n\n# This is the commit message #8:\n\n[cloud] EC2 dynamic inventory default filename is documented as ec2.ini - fixes #24396 (#24515)\n\n* the default filename is ec2.ini\n\n(to override that use the env var EC2_INI_PATH)\n\n* allow fallback to ec2.ini\n\n# This is the commit message #9:\n\nImport from urllib and not url (#25102)\n\n* Import from urllib and not url\n\nIn Python 3, the correct way to import urlparse is through urllib.parse.\n\n* Use six module to import urlparse\n\nImport urlparse from ansible.module_utils.six. This way, the import statement is compatible both with Python 3 and Python 2.\n\n* Fix urlparse import using six module\n\nThe correct import is: from six.moves.urllib.parse import urlparse\n\n* Import six from ansible.compat\n\n* Import from six.moves. Don't make six global.\n\nPrevent code smell by not making six available in the global namespace and instead importing from one of its subpackages.\n\n# This is the commit message #10:\n\nFix inventory script for Foreman where group by pattern are not prope… (#25173)\n\n* Fix inventory script for Foreman where group by pattern are not properly safe-guarded.\n\n* Fix pep8 error about tab mixed with blanks.\n\n# This is the commit message #1:\n\nAdd Cloudlinux support for hostname.py\n\n**SUMMARY**\n\nAdd Cloudlinux 6 and Cloudlinux 7 support\n\n**ISSUE TYPE**\n\nFeature Pull Request\n\n**COMPONENT NAME**\n\nlib/ansible/modules/system/hostname.py\n\n**ANSIBLE VERSION** ``` 2.4 ```\n\n# This is the commit message #2:\n\nFix module name in example\n\n'sv' module name in example refers to non-existent module.\n\n# This is the commit message #3:\n\nAllow customize fail message of wait_for module\n\n# This is the commit message #4:\n\nmade doc more tolerant and recursive for spec\n\n# This is the commit message #5:\n\nminor doc update\n\n# This is the commit message #6:\n\nfix state present nxos_evpn_vni (#25212)\n\nSigned-off-by: Trishna Guha <trishnaguha17@gmail.com>\n\n# This is the commit message #7:\n\nnxos_feature fix and unit test (#25200)\n\n* nxos_feature fix\n\nSigned-off-by: Trishna Guha <trishnaguha17@gmail.com>\n\n* nxos_feature unit test\n\nSigned-off-by: Trishna Guha <trishnaguha17@gmail.com>\n\n* remove from pep8/legacy-file\n\nSigned-off-by: Trishna Guha <trishnaguha17@gmail.com>\n\n# This is the commit message #8:\n\nTemporary work-around for setuptools 36.0.0 bug. This is different to not passing a `target_group_arns` list at all which can signify no change.\n\nRemove unnecessary empty list construction, as it must already be an empty list to get to that point.\n\n# This is the commit message #2:\n\nFacts Refresh (2.4 roadmap) (#23012)\n\nFacts Refresh (2.4 roadmap)\n\nThis commit implements most of the 2.4 roadmap 'Facts Refresh' - move facts.py to facts/__init__.py - move facts Distribution() to its own class - add a facts/utils.py - move get_file_content and get_uname_version to facts/utils.py - move Facts() class from facts/__init__ to facts/facts.py - mv get_file_lines to facts/utils.py - mv Ohai()/Facter() class to facts/ohai.py and facter.py - Start moving fact Hardware() classes to facts/hardware/*.py - mv HPUX() hardware class to facts/hardware/hpux.py - move SunOSHardware() fact class to facts/hardware/sunos.py - move OpenBSDHardware() class to facts/hardware/openbsd.py - mv FreeBsdHardware() and DragonFlyHardware() to facts/hardware/ - mv NetBSDHardware() to facts/hardware/netbsd.py - mv Darwin() hardware class to facts/hardware/darwin.py - pep8/etc cleanups on facts/hardware/*.py - Mv network facts classes to facts/network/*.py - mv Virtual fact classes to facts/virtual - mv Hardware.get_sysctl to facts/sysctl.py:get_sysctl\n\n- Also mv get_uname_version from facts/utils.py -> distribution.py   since distribution.py is the only thing using it.\n\n- add collector.py with new BaseFactCollector - add a subclass for AnsibleFactCollector - hook up dict key munging FactNamespaces - add some test cases for testing the names of facts - mv timeout stuff to facts.timeout\n\n- rm ansible_facts()/get_all_facts() etc\n\n- Instead of calling facts.ansible_facts(), fact collection   api used by setup.py is now to create an AnsibleFactCollector()   and call it's collect method.\n\n- replace Facts.get_user_facts with UserFactCollector - add a 'systems' facts package, mv UserFactCollector there - mv get_dns_facts to DnsFactCollector - mv get_env_facts to EnvFactCollector - include the timeout length in exception message\n\n- modules and module_utils that use AnsibleFactCollector   can now theoretically set the 'valid_subsets'\n\n  May be useful for network facts module that currently have   to reimplement a good chunk of facts.py to get gather_subsets   to work.\n\n- get_local_facts -> system/LocalFactCollector - get_date_time -> system/date_time.py - get_fips_facts -> system/fips.py - get_caps_facts() -> system/caps.py - get_apparmor_facts -> system/apparmor.py - get_selinux_facts -> system/selinux.py - get_lsb_facts -> system/lsb.py - get_service_mgr_facts -> system/service_mgr.py - Facts.is_systemd_managed ->  system/service_mgr.py - get_pkg_mgr_facts -> system/pkg_mgr.py - Facts()._get_mount_size_facts() -> facts.utils.get_mount_size()\n\n- add unit test for EnvFactCollector - add a test case for minimal gather_subsets - add test case for collect_ids - Make gather_subset match existing behavior or '!all'\n\n    If 'gather_subset' is provided as '!all', the existing behavior     (in 2.2/2.3) is that means 'dont collect any facts except those     from the Facts() class'. So 'skip everything except     'apparmor', 'caps', 'date_time', 'env', 'fips', 'local', 'lsb',     'pkg_mgr', 'python', 'selinux', 'service_mgr', 'user', 'platform', etc.\n\n    The new facts setup was making '!all' mean no facts at all, since     it can add/exclude at a finer granularity. Since that makes more     sense for the ansible collector, and the set of minimal facts to     collect is really more up to setup.py to decide we do just that.\n\n    So if setup.py needs to always collect some gather_subset, even     on !all, setup.py needs to have the that subset added to the     list it passes as minimal_gather_subset.\n\n    This should fix some intg tests that assume '!all' means that     some facts are still collected (user info and env for example).\n\n    If we want to make setup.py collect a more minimal set, we can do that.\n\n- force facts_dicts.keys() to a list so py3 works - split fact collector tests to test_collectors.py\n\n- convert Facter(Facts) -> other/facter.py:FacterFactCollector\n\n- add FactCollector.collect_with_namespace()\n\n    regular .collect() will return a dict with the key names     using the base names ('ip_address', 'service_mgr' etc)\n\n    .collect_with_namespace() will return a dict where the key names     have been transformed with the collectors namespace, if there is     one. For most, this means a namespace that adds 'ansible_' to the     start of the key name.\n\n    For 'FacterFactCollector', the namespace transforms the key to     'facter_*'.\n\n- add test cases for collect_with_namespace\n\n- move all the concrete 'which facts does setup.py' stuff to setup.py\n\n    The caller of AnsibleFactCollector.from_gather_subset() needs to     pass in the list of collector classes now.\n\n- update system/setup.py to import all of the fact classes and pass   in that list. - split the Distribution fact class up a bit\n\n    extracted the 'distro release' file handling (ie, linux     boxes with /etc/release, /etc/os-release etc) into its     own class. - extract get_cmdline_facts -> cmdline.py - extract get_public_ssh_host_keys -> system/ssh_pub_keys.py - extract get_platform_facts -> system/platform.py\n\n  platform.py may be a good candidate for further splitting.\n\n- rm test for plain Facts() base class - let the base class for Collector unit tests provide collected_facts\n\n    some Collectors and/or their migrated Facts() subsclasses need     to look at facts collected by other modules ('ansible_architecture'     the main one...).\n\n    Collector.collect() has the collected_facts arg for this, so add     a class variable to BaseFactsTest so we can specify it.\n\n- mv Ohai to other/ohai.py and convert to Collector - update hardware/*.py to return facts (no side effects)\n\n- mv AnsibleFactCollector to setup.py - extra collector class gathering to module method in   facts/__init__.py (collector_classes_from_gather_subset) - add a CollectorMetaDataCollector collector used to provide   the 'gather_setup' fact - add unit test module for 'setup' module   (test/units/modules/system/setup.py)\n\n- Collector init now doesnt need a module, but collect does\n\n    An instance of a FactCollector() isnt tied to a AnsibleModule     instance, but the collect() method can be, so optionally pass     in module to FactCollector.collect() (everywhere)\n\n- add a default_collectors for list of default collectors\n\n  import and use it from setup.py module\n\n  eventually, would like to replace this with a plugin loader   style class finder/loader\n\n- unit tests for module_utils/facts/__init__.py - add unit tests for ohai facts collector - remove self.facts side effect on populate() in hardware/sunos.py - convert OpenBSDHardware() to rm side effects on self.facts - try to rm some self.facts side effects in Network()\n\n    plumb in collected_facts from populate() where it is needed.\n\n    stop passing collected_facts into Network() [via cached_facts=,     where it eventually becomes self.facts]\n\n- nothing provides Fact() cached_facts arg now, rm it\n\n    Facts() should be internal only implementation so nothing     should be using it.\n\n    Of course, now someone will.\n\n- add a Collector.name attr to build a map of name->_fact_ids\n\n    To properly exclude a gather_subset spec like '!hardware', we     need to know that 'hardware' also means 'devices', 'dmi', etc.     Before, '!hardware' would remove the 'hardware' collector name     but not 'devices'. Since both would end up in id_collector_map,     we would still end up with the HardwareCollector in the collector     list. End result being that '!hardware' wouldn't stop hardware     from being collected.\n\n    So we need to be able to build that map, so add the Collector.name     attribute that is the primary name (like 'hardware') and let     Collector._fact_ids be the other fact ids that a collector is     responsible for.\n\n    Construct the aliases_map of Collector.name -> set of _fact_ids     in fact/__init__.py get_collector_names, and use it when we are     populating the exclude set.\n\n- refactor of distribution.py\n\n    make the big OS_FAMILY literal a little easier to read     Also keys can now be any string instead of python literals\n\n    99% sure the test for 'KDE Neon' was wrong     I don't see how/where it should or could get 'Neon' instead     of 'KDE Neon' as provided in os-release NAME=\n\n    Use 'distribution' string for key to OS_MAP\n\n    ie, we dont need to make it a valid python label anymore so dont.\n\n    move _has_dist_file to module as _file_exists     easier to mock without mucking with os.path\n\n    mv platform.system() calls to within get_distribution_facts() instead     of Distribution() init.\n\n- remove _json compat module\n\n    The code in here was to support:\n\n      -a 'json' python module that was not the standard one included       with python since 2.6.\n\n      - potentially fallback to simplejson if 'json' was not available.\n\n    'json' is available for all supported python versions now so     no longer needed.\n\n- mv get_collector_names -> facts.collector - mv collector_classes_from_gather_subset -> facts.collector - mv collector tests from test_facts -> test_collector\n\n- Use six's reduce() in sunos/netbsd hardware facts\n\n- rm extraneous get_uname_version in utils\n\n  only system/distribution.py uses it\n\n- Remove Facts() subclass metaclass usage\n\n  - using fact_id and a platform id for matching collectors\n\n    gut most of Facts() subclasses\n\n    rm Facts() subclasses with weird metaclass\n\n    only add collectors that match the fact_ids and the platform_info     to the list of collectors used.\n\n    atm, a collectors platform_id will default to 'Generic', and     any platform matches 'Generic'\n\n    goal is to select collector classes including matching the     systems platform in collector.py, instead of relying on     metaclasses in hardware/*. To finish this, the various     Facts() subclasses will need to be replaced entirely with     Collector() subclasses.\n\n    use collector classmethod platform_match() to match the platform\n\n    This lets the particular class decide if it is compatible with     a given platform_info. platform_info is a dict like obj, so it could be     expanded in the future.\n\n    Add a default platform_match to BaseFactCollector that matches     platform_info['system'] == cls._platform\n\n    They were needed previously to trigger a module     load on all the collector classes when we import     facts/hardare so that the Hardware() and related     classes that used __new__ and find_all_subclasses()     would work.\n\n    Now that is done in collectors based on platform matching     at runtime we dont need to do it py module import/parse     time. So the non empty __init__.pys are no longer needed     and their is a more flexible mechanism for selection     platform specific stuff.\n\n    facts/facts.py is no longer used, rm'ed\n\n- if we dont find an implement class for gather spec.. just ignore it.\n\n  Would be useful to add a warn to warn about this case.\n\n- Fix SD-UX typo (should be HP-UX)\n\n- Port fix for #21893 (0 sockets) to this branch\n\n    This readds the change from 8ad182059d5a085e4f8ecfe8ae63bad14a7dc01c     that got lost in merge/rebase\n\n    Fixes #21893\n\n- port sunos fact locale fix for #24542 to this branch\n\n    based on e558ec19cd1fd9d00e299cf1938d4ca3cec85cda\n\n    Fixes #24542\n\n    Solaris fact fix (#24793)\n\n    ensure locale for solaris fact gathering\n\n    fixes issue with locale interfering with proper reading of decimals\n\n- raise exceptions in the air like we just dont care.\n\n    Pretty much ignore any not exit exception in facts     collection. And add some test cases.\n\n- added new selinux fact to clarify python lib\n\n    the selinux fact is boolean false when the library is not installed,     a dictionary/hash otherwise, but this is ambigous     added new fact so we can eventually remove the type dichtomy and normalize it as a dict\n\n    Re-add of devel commit 85c7a7b844bf429fc9cc0ffce5dd9bf05ed47b5a to     the new code layout, since it got removed in merge/rebase\n\n# This is the commit message #3:\n\ngce_instance_template: Fix subnetwork not working (#25231)\n\n* Fix problem with subnetwork not working\n\nIt is broken in the current master branch. #6:\n\nImports and includes (#25399)\n\nInitial commit to split includes into static imports/dynamic includes\n\nThis implements the new include/import syntax for Ansible 2.4: * include_{tasks,role,variables} = dynamic * import_{playbook,tasks,role} = static\n\nThe old bare `include` will be considered deprecated, as will any use of the `static: {yes|no}` option.\n\nThis also adds docs for import/include and reorganizing the "Playbook Reuse" section of the documentation.\n\n# This is the commit message #7:\n\nRemoving auto-generated doc from previous import/include the commit message #10:\n\nAdd python-lxml to docker images (#25324)\n\n# This is the commit message #1:\n\nWhen cleaning up the AnsiBallZ tempdir we need to not fail if the tempdir wasn't created\n\nIf the temp directory creation failed in mkdtemp then temp_path is never given a value.  This would lead to a NameError exception which would obfuscate the original error (out of disk space being a common one).  By catching NameError, python will raise the original exception as we want.\n\nFixes #17215\n\n# This is the commit message #2:\n\nFix nxos_vpc idempotence issues (#25219)\n\n* Fix nxos_vpc idempotence issues\n\n* Remove legacy-file pep8 now passing\n\n# This is the commit message #3:\n\nAdd tzdata back (#25433)\n\nIt appears that the base Docker images have removed tzdata. with dbus-launch (dconf requires a running DBus user session). Updated documentation to mention external module dependencies.\n\n* Fixed remote execution for the dconf module when state=absent by wrapping the invocation with dbus-launch (dconf requires a running DBus user session).\n\n* Updated dconf module implementation to make it more robust:\n\n- Detect running D-Bus session, and reuse that one if possible. - If detection fails, try launching process via dbus-run-session to avoid   left-over D-Bus processes. - As last resort run dbus-launch, and clean-up after the changes have been   made. - Updated documentation to mention new dependencies and to be more explicit   about module limitations.\n\n* Fixed PEP8 errors reported by ansibot in dconf module.\n\n* Updated dconf module implementation:\n\n- Fail early if psutil library is not available on the system. - Go through all of user's processes to locate a running D-Bus daemon. - Test potential D-Bus session bus address before deciding to (re)use it. - Added a couple of debug statements. - Updated documentation to include dbus-send as requirement.\n\n* Updated dconf module implementation:\n\n- Simplified module, removing all code for handling dbus-daemon, as discussed in   a community meeting. - Module user must ensure that D-Bus user session is available and specified   either via module parameter or environment variable. - Updated documentation for the change.\n\n* Updated dconf module implementation:\n\n- Add back ability to detect running D-Bus user session. - Fail-back to using dbus-run-session if running session could not be detected.\n\n* PEP8 fix for dconf module.\n\n* Updated dconf module implementation:\n\n- Introduce correct examples for Gnome DE. - Rename existing examples to mark them as Cinnamon-specific. - Use self.module.get_bin_path instead of custom check for dbus-run-session. - Fixed typo in method documentation for DconfPreference.reset().\n\n# This is the commit message #10:\n\nAdd missing modules (#25483)\n\n# This is the commit message other) errors\n\nIn places where we need to catch a yaml error and raise an AnsibleError, add the orig yaml exc to the AnsibleError via the orig_exc arg.\n\nWhen the AnsibleError is displayed it will now include the AnsibleError (AnsibleParserError for example) and the type and message from the original yaml exception.\n\nThis provides more detail to the error messages related to yaml errors.\n\nThis also improves errors from dataloader (for example, previously if a wrong password was used for a vault encrypted yaml file, the error was very vague and suggested yaml errors, but now the message includes the original exception from vault indicating the password was incorrect or missing).\n\nAdd a text note to playbook helper asserts. For playbook syntax/layout errors that aren't yaml errors, but errors indicating invalid data structures for a playbook/task/role/block, we now include some info about where the assert was and why it was raised.\n\nIn places we raise an AnsibleParserError in an except clause, pass the original exception to AnsibleParserError via orig_exc arg.\n\nMake assorted error messages a little more specific (like the playbook helper load methods)\n\n* Revert "Include the original YAML error in syntax error messages"\n\nThis reverts commit 781bb44b029becef60af9c9ce765129c7c9c7287.\n\n# This is the commit So the logic here wasn't right to begin with (It just means that a value at the 0-th position would never show up as cached).  Need to compare against None to know if the value exists in the cache.\n\nhttps://redis-py.readthedocs.io/en/latest/#redis.StrictRedis.zrank\n\nFixes #25590\n\n# This is the commit message #9:\n\nGet warnings/deprecations per item in loop\n\nwarnings and deprecations were only returned for the top level of a task, this now deals with them in loop deduplication still occurs so only unique ones will be shown to user.\n\nfixes #25258\n\n# This is the commit message #10:\n\nadd validation to fetch for source/dest\n\nalso added missing display\n\n# This is the commit message #1:\n\nadd deprecation notice for sudo/su cli options (#23983)\n\n* add deprecation notice for sudo/su cli options\n\n* updated as per feedback\n\n# This is the commit message #2:\n\ndraft constructed groups plugin (#23374)\n\n* draft constructed groups plugin\n\ncan use fact cache as vars source\n\n* pw4er5e\n\n# This is the commit message #3:\n\nwin_firewall: check-mode support, integration tests (#25127)\n\n* win_firewall: check-mode support, integration tests\n\nThis PR includes: - It relies on functionality specific to Linux (as does the existing sysfs-based code which it extends), but should not cause issues on other platforms.\n\nMoreover, it prevents virtual devices from being excluded, and links such devices to the physical devices to which they are attached.\n\n# This is the commit message #8:\n\n[cloud] Fix Route53 module value option, defaulting to empty list (#24555)\n\n# This is the commit message #9:\n\nvmware_guest: Various fixes to VM customizations (from template) (#24768)\n\n* Various fixes to VM customizations (from template)\n\nThis patch implements: - New find_obj() function from vmware.py replacing get_obj() - Implement proper resource_pool selection - Fix productId implementation (was not working) - Ensure that we are not changing anything that is not mandatory (hostName, orgName, fullName)\n\nThis is an alternative proposal to #24283 This does not fix #19860 yet though.\n\nFor our use-case, we do not want to customize the network information (or any information in fact). commit message #8:\n\n[cloud] Route53 Avoid throttling errors and unnecessary processing when checking rrsets. (#22104)\n\nThe boto Route53 get_all_rrsets method will return the record set matching the name, type, and identifier specified, followed by ALL subsequent sets in alphabetical order based on name. If the specified set does not exist, the method will still return all the sets that _would_ have come after it. Searching through sets we know will not match is not just a waste of resources but, more importantly, often triggers AWS API throttling when used on zones with large numbers of records.\n\n# This is the commit message #9:\n\n[cloud] ec2.py: add region to the aws_connect_kwargs before creating vpc connection Fixes #25673 (#25749)\n\n* add region to the aws_connect_kwargs before creating vpc connection\n\n* remove unused import\n\n# This is the commit message #10:\n\nPEP 8 fixes.\n\n# This is the commit message #1:\n\nDo not set default value for any_errors_fatal in Base\n\nSetting default values for FieldAttribute values created in the Base class prevents the _get_parent_attribute() code from working correctly, as the value is always non-None.\n\nRelated to #22924\n\n# This is For example, Debian currently ship passlib with a __version__ of '1.7.0.post20161128115349'\n\nStrictVersion throws an exception when parsing this version string.\n\nChange to using LooseVersion which successfully parses version strings such as this.\n\nFixes #20199\n\n# This is the commit message #8:\n\nadded integration tests for apt upgrade (#25670)\n\n* added integration tests for apt upgrade\n\nchanged version number for hello to 2.6 so that it works with Ubuntu 12.04\n\nprevent tests from checking if aptitude is installed on non ubuntu systems\n\nchanged ordering on when statements for safe and full upgrade types so that the OS check happens before the aptitude check\n\nadded integration tests for apt upgrade\n\nchanged version number for hello to 2.6 so that it works with Ubuntu 12.04\n\n* Moved additions to tasks/main.yml to make revisions easier. <trishnaguha17@gmail.com>\n\n# This is the commit message #5:\n\n[cloud] iam_cert return arn and allow use with ansible vault (#20787)\n\n* iam_cert.py Fix duplicate certificate detection with included chains.\n\nThe iam_cert module would fail to detect certificates as duplicates if the certificate body included the authority chain directly.\n\nThis commit fixes the problem by checking if a given certificate matches the start of the data returned by AWS, since in all cases where they would match the certificate will come first.\n\n* iam_cert.py Return certificate ARN in all success cases.\n\nWhen uploading certificates or interacting with IAM, the certificate ARN is needed for other operations with AWS such as provisioning elastic load balancers.\n\nThis commit returns the certificate ARN in all success cases, which allows it to be used to idempotently provision other Amazon services depending on it (ELBs being an immediate example).\n\n# This is the commit message #6:\n\n[cloud] New module ec2_vpc_endpoint_facts for AWS EC2 VPC Endpoints (#20211)\n\n* New facts module for AWS EC2 VPC Endpoints\n\n* ec2_vpc_endpoint_facts - meet latest Ansible standards\n\nFix exception syntax and use of `iteritems` for python3\n\nFix undefined `ec2` variable (should have been `connection` Address various flake8 issues\n\nUse `ansible_dict_to_boto3_filter_list` rather than duplicating its implementation\n\n* Remove max_items and next_token from vpc_endpoint_facts\n\nmax_items and next_token should be a module concern, not a caller concern. It would be very difficult for a module consumer to use next_token properly, whereas it's easy for the module to handle it.\n\n* ec2_vpc_endpoint_facts trivially supports check mode\n\nAdd supports_check_mode=True to the argument spec.\n\n* Improve RETURN documentation for ec2_vpc_endpoint_facts\n\nFix bug in EXAMPLE documentation too\n\n* fix return type for validate-modules\n\n# This is the commit message #7:\n\nAdd support for Red Hat Atomic Host (#25906)\n\nFix adds support for Red Hat Enterprise Linux Atomic Host. d99ff598b51f96c16d4460a9522e99abeb1ad300;Tim <tim.schumacher@nokia.com>;1555698225;-0400;Patch CVE-2019-11324\n\nVulnerable versions: < 1.24.2 Patched version: 1.24.2 The urllib3 library before 1.24.2 for Python mishandles certain cases where the desired set of CA certificates is different from the OS store of CA certificates, which results in SSL connections succeeding in situations where a verification failure is the correct outcome. This is related to use of the ssl_context, ca_certs, or ca_certs_dir argument.

This attack appear to be exploitable via Attacker provides JSON data in incorrect encoding. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in 0.12.3.\n\nRequests: CVE-2018-18074 More information moderate severity Vulnerable versions: <= 2.19.1 Patched version: 2.20.0 The Requests package through 2.19.1 before 2018-09-14 for Python sends an HTTP Authorization header to an http URI upon receiving a same-hostname https-to-http redirect, which makes it easier for remote attackers to discover credentials by sniffing the network.
